page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT IN PANTON
page.content: The workforce of {PANTON }consists of 47 adults. There are l2 adults who live and work in the square of whom 9 are employed solely in agriculture. These are all male. Of the remaining 35, l9 are women who do not work out- side the home. Of the remaining l6, 8 work outside the square in local towns and 8 are either self-employed or un- employed. Because of the lack of public transport those unemployed and without personal transport would find it almost impossible to travel outside the area to work. Unemployment is a very big social problem in the country as a whole at present and living in a rural area these problems are exacer- bated. One resident is attempting to set up a sewing workshop. Six women are employed machining high quality dresses to sell in London but this is a very new enterprise of a few months.
